intro: Seseli tenuisectum, commonly known as narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Seseli tenuisectum is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
